item.title: Atlassian acquires Rewatch as it gets into AI meeting bots
item.dc:creator: Frederic Lardinois
item.description:
Atlassian plans to integrate Rewatch into its recently launched Rovo AI platform so that transcripts become searchable within the overall business context.

item.title: Sub.club aims to fund the fediverse via premium feeds
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
Sub.club thinks premium feeds could also serve other use cases, like supporting helpful bots or generating funds to help maintain a community's Mastodon server, for instance.

item.title: Gmail users on Android can now chat with Gemini about their emails
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
Gmail users on Android devices can now chat directly with Google’s AI assistant, Gemini, about their emails in the Gmail app. Google rolled out the new feature, Gmail Q&A, on Thursday to users who pay for Gemini, according to a blog post, and announced the feature would be coming to iOS devices. With Gmail Q&A, […]

item.title: Tesla keeps putting its digital history in the memory hole
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description:
It seems that the Ministry of Truth has been busy at Tesla. Some sharp-eyed folks, including reporters at Electrek, noticed that Tesla has deleted all of its blog posts prior to 2019. Those blog posts are a digital history of the company, covering everything from CEO Elon Musk’s original master plan, to the first Autopilot […]

item.title: Spotify points finger at Apple over an unwelcome change to volume control technology
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
When streaming to connected devices via Spotify Connect on iOS, users were previously able to use the physical buttons on their iPhone to adjust the volume. But this will no longer work.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Generative AI coding startup Magic lands $320M investment from Eric Schmidt, Atlassian and others
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Magic, an AI startup creating models to generate code and automate a range of software development tasks, has raised a large tranche of cash from investors including ex-Google CEO Eric Schmidt. In a blog post on Thursday, Magic said that it closed a $320 million fundraising round with contributions from Schmidt, as well as Alphabet’s […]

item.title: Uber cozies up to more AV companies, Canoo loses another founder and Waymo sees potential in teen riders
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description:
Welcome back to TechCrunch Mobility — your central hub for news and insights on the future of transportation. Sign up here for free — just click TechCrunch Mobility! item.title: Apple Sports gets updated ahead of football season with Live Activities, play-by-play and more
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description:
Ahead of the NFL and college football (NCAAF) seasons, Apple announced updates for its sports-focused app, including Live Activities for all leagues, a new “dynamic drive tracker” that visualizes where the ball is on the field and support for play-by-play of football games.  Launched in February, Apple Sports is a free iOS app for sports […]

item.title: After winning a landmark case against real estate agents, this startup aims to replace them with a flat fee
item.dc:creator: Mary Ann Azevedo
item.description:
One of the people who successfully sued the National Association of Realtors (NAR) to change real estate commissions has co-founded a new real estate startup. It all began in 2017 when Josh Sitzer and his wife listed their home for sale in Kansas City. The couple was frustrated by the fact they had to pay […]

item.title: X caught blocking links to NPR, claiming the news site may be ‘unsafe’
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
X, the Elon Musk-owned platform formerly known as Twitter, is marking some links to news organization NPR’s website as “unsafe” when users click through to read the latest story about an altercation between a Trump campaign staffer and an Arlington National Cemetery employee. The warning being displayed is typically applied to malicious links, like those […]

item.title: Apple event 2024: How to watch the iPhone 16 launch
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
Apple is likely to unveil its iPhone 16 series of phones and maybe even some Apple Watches at its Glowtime event on September 9.

item.title: GitHub Copilot competitor Codeium raises $150M at a $1.25B valuation
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Codeium, a startup developing an AI-powered tool to rival GitHub Copilot, has raised $150 million at a $1.25 billion valuation.

item.title: TechCrunch Minute: Here’s why AI has a hard time spelling ‘strawberry’
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description:
Is AI going to take my job one day? I hope not. But in the meantime, I can do something that ChatGPT can’t: I can spell the word “strawberry.” Once again, some posts are circulating around social media that expose how high-powered AI text generators fail to know how to count — for example, how […]

item.title: Flying through Seattle’s hacked airport
item.dc:creator: Devin Coldewey
item.description:
Seattle's Airport is still largely offline, causing chaos among travelers and acting as a standing warning against taking cybersecurity lightly.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Two Oxford PhDs are building an app to let you remix photos into memes
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
Earlier this month, Google released a new feature with the Pixel 9 series phone to let users add the photographer in the group photo by swapping someone out and taking another photo. A new social network by a duo of Oxford PhDs is working on an app to let you add friends to a photo […]

item.title: Meta now allows preteens to explore Horizon Worlds with parent’s permission
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description:
Meta is now letting preteens with parent-managed accounts explore different experiences in its online virtual reality (VR) platform, Horizon Worlds, with certain restrictions in place. The company announced that parents will soon be able to approve age-appropriate worlds they’d like their preteens (aged 10 to 12) to experience, including hanging out in The Space Station, […]

item.title: IBM Cloud to offer Intel’s Gaudi 3 AI chips next year
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Intel has found its first -- and perhaps only -- cloud customer for its Gaudi 3 AI accelerator chips: IBM Cloud.

item.title: Russian government hackers found using exploits made by spyware companies NSO and Intellexa
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description:
Google said the findings were an example of how exploits developed by spyware makers can end up in the hands of "dangerous threat actors."

item.title: Social network Butterflies AI adds a feature that turns you into an AI character
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description:
Butterflies AI, the new social network where humans and AIs interact with each other, is launching a new Clones feature that turns you into an AI character. This latest addition builds on a feature launched to the public back in June that lets users create AI personas, called Butterflies, that automatically create posts on the […]

item.title: UK’s Wayve secures strategic investment from Uber to further develop self-driving tech
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description:
Uber is making a strategic investment into Wayve as an extension of the U.K.-born startup’s previously announced $1.05 billion Series C round. The partnership will also see the two companies work with automakers to integrate Wayve’s AI into consumer vehicles that will one day operate on the ride-hail giant’s platform.
